channel.title: Help with connection
channel.description:
I have edited all the server files to my server name etc and then with the client, I have the ip set to my host name (no-ip.info) and it still says error connecting to server.
I have got the no-ip duc running and I am using uTorrent to portfoward through port 43594 and it still says error connecting to server..
Please can someone help me (I'm pretty new)

item.title: Help with connection
item.dc:creator: @g0d_of_war1 g0d of war1
item.description:
@g0d_of_war1 wrote:

[quote=“JynxGoesPro, post:1, topic:416057”]I have edited all the server files to my server name etc and then with the client, I have the ip set to my host name (no-ip.info) and it still says error connecting to server.

I have got the no-ip duc running and I am using uTorrent to portfoward through port 43594 and it still says error connecting to server…

Please can someone help me (I’m pretty new)[/quote] lool msg me ur teamviewer ill help u

Read full topic

item.title: Help with connection
item.dc:creator: @marcus_nunez marcus nunez
item.description:
@marcus_nunez wrote:

[quote=“JynxGoesPro, post:6, topic:416057”][quote author=marcus nunez link=topic=517997.msg3763583#msg3763583 date=1317068147]
Some Clients do not respond to uTorrent Portfowarding. Try portfowarding through your router page and see if that works.
[/quote]

Ok. I will try this soon. But as I said above. It still doesn’t allow me to go back to LAN[/quote]
Oh alright well if you can post pictures of it I might be able to help you alot better. If you need any help Just Pm me and I will help ASAP.

Read full topic

item.description:
@JynxGoesPro wrote:

Some Clients do not respond to uTorrent Portfowarding. Try portfowarding through your router page and see if that works.

item.title: Help with connection
item.dc:creator: @marcus_nunez marcus nunez
item.description:
@marcus_nunez wrote:

Some Clients do not respond to uTorrent Portfowarding. Try portfowarding through your router page and see if that works.

item.title: Help with connection
item.dc:creator: @JynxGoesPro JynxGoesPro
item.description:
@JynxGoesPro wrote:

liivapuu13:

Use google port checker and check you port 43594…

Already have. The port is open. And now I have changed it all back to 127.0.0.1 and even tried 0.0.0.0 but it won’t even let me connect offline now? :L

Read full topic

item.title: Help with connection
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

liivapuu13:

Use google port checker and check you port 43594…

www.canyouseeme.org is better. It can check more than just port 43594.
